MASKIN&ELEKTROco.ltd specialisis in radio- and
TV distribution. A number of experts specialising in the many
important different directions within the electrontechnical
sphere and a large collection of instruments for all imaginable
development-, service- and measuring purposes are employed.
The company owns a four-story office building in the city of
Orebro with commodious premises.
The founder of the company, Mr. R. Zetterlund, is a pioneer
in Sweden in the tape recording sphere. In 1946 he brought
in his luggage from U. S. the First nori^roFessional
taperecorder ever to cross the border into Sweden. That was
a »Soundmirror» from the Brush Development Co. in Cleve¬
land, Ohio. Some hundreds of this machine were imported
before the import ban came into force in Sweden during the
spring of 1947. After more than one year of negotiations
with the American manufacturer it was agreed to start the
manufacturing of a Swedish »Soundmirror». However, the
difficulties were great because of the lack of raw materials
and skilled technicians. In the meantime progress in U. S. A.
had reached a new point necessitating the investment of a
lot more money, if the manufacturing were to continue.
Therefore the manufacturing company was taken over by the
L. M. Ericsson Telephone Co., which company still is producing
taperecorders in the factory.
The Tandberg factory has always been
first with new developments. Thus in
Europe the first taperecorder with a
super low speed of 1 %" ps and the
first machine with 3 different recording
speeds and also the first machine with
Hi-Fi and a frequency response of
30—16000 cps ± 2 dB, were developed
in this factory. Finally the factory is
now in full production of the first
stereophonic taperecorder on the European
market and at a very reasonable price.
The combination of the Tandberg
stereophonic Hi-Fi taperecorder and two
Tandberg Hi-Fi loudspeakers gives a
sound reproduction only comparable to
a very high class professional equipment.
Mr. Zetterlund had however found a growing market for tape-
recorders and therefore investigated the products of different
foreign manufacturers. He found that the best nonprofessional
taperecorder he had ever seen was manufactured by the Tand¬
berg Radio Factory in Norway and furthermore, that this
machine could be sold at a reasonable price. It was agreed
that the new company, MASKIN & ELEKTRO CO. LTD,
founded by Mr. Zetterlund, should work as exclusive repre¬
sentative in Sweden for this taperecorder and other products
produced by the same factory. The selling of the Tandberg
taperecorder started during the spring of 1953. Very soon
it became the main product of the company and the selling
has grown year after year.
Wghi now the Tandberg taperecorder is the most popular
and the best selling recorder in Sweden.
The Tandberg Radio factory, as the
name indicates, is also manufacturing
radio sets. The highest quality of radio
receivers is produced, high sensitivity and
a perfect sound quality and a lot of
refinements are characteristic of their
production. The radio models therefore
met with outstanding success on the
Swedish market. Also with regard to
radio receivers the Tandberg factory is
in the highest class. The latest model
with a Hi-Fi amplifier, built together
with an AM and a FM receiver, is
something very new, and up to now no
other European factory has produced
anything of that class.
